definition: to examine critically to bring out essential elements
example: Students analyze the author's argument in the passage.

definition: to come near in distance or time
example: As the exam approaches, plan your study schedule.

definition: to evaluate or estimate the value of something
example: The teacher assessed each essay with a rubric.

definition: an abstract idea or general notion
example: Understanding the concept helps you answer inference questions.

definition: to obtain something from a source
example: Many English words derive from Latin roots.

definition: to divide and hand out
example: Volunteers distribute handouts before the listening drill.

definition: the wealth and resources of a region
example: The lecture compared the digital economy with traditional trade.

definition: the surroundings influencing development
example: A supportive environment encourages daily review.

definition: to set up or found
example: We establish baseline vocabulary scores during onboarding.

definition: a circumstance contributing to a result
example: A major factor in TOEFL success is consistent practice.

definition: a method or statement of facts
example: The speaking formula guides students through integrated tasks.

definition: the purpose or role of something
example: Each drill has a clear function within the weekly sprint.

definition: to recognize or name
example: Learners identify paraphrases in reading passages.

definition: to explain the meaning of
example: Can you interpret the professor's attitude?

definition: related to law
example: The reading passage discussed legal reforms in education.

definition: a systematic way of doing something
example: Shadowing is a proven method for improving listening.

definition: to happen
example: Brainstorming sessions occur every Friday evening.

definition: a course of action by an organization
example: Our late policy allows one make-up session.

definition: a fundamental truth or rule
example: Spaced repetition is a principle of long-term retention.

definition: to continue or move forward
example: After feedback, students proceed with the second practice set.

definition: investigation to discover facts
example: Research shows bilingual hints accelerate learning.

definition: to answer or react
example: Learners respond to prompts using new vocabulary.

definition: the arrangement of parts
example: Analyze the structure of the lecture before answering.

definition: a set of ideas to explain facts
example: The theory lecture connected vocabulary to cognition.
